author: Angelo Petropolis
comment: The functionality this app provides should have been available in OEM Android Wear to begin with.  This is a welcomed app.  However,  it still has problems. Even with the paid app,  I can only see my canned phrases during replys only. These are not visible or available for new text messaging. Fix this & would be worth 5 stars.
title: Nice Android Wear Addition,  But. . .

author: Peter Ison
comment: Would be great if everything worked all of the time. Works for first time on my Zenwatch 2 but then responses fail to show up on the watch. Tried uninstalling and reinstalling and again, worked the first time but then canned responses dropped off.
title: Looks good and functions OK at first...

author: Beatrice Gatta
comment: Nice idea, but with other similar and cheaper apps out there, you just want to wait for coffee, talkey or Android to implement the "add frequently used replies" function. I've noticed this trend of making wearable apps more expensive than the smartphone ones. Maybe people think that if you are going to shell out 300bucks for a watch, it means you're rich (and stupid) enough to buy every app that adds a basic function to it so you don't have to wait 2 months for an update. It needs a 2weeks trial version.
title: Pay walls so high I can't even try the app

author: Waylander
comment: Does not work at all. This isn't my first rodeo so I know how to use the app. Plain and simple, it doesn't work. Might be an Android Wear 2.0 thing. Please fix or give me a refund.

author: Daniel Brooker
comment: This app does not work at all on my Huawei Watch and Nexus 5 phone (both running marshmallow). I ran the app on my phone, setup some canned responses, made sure the app was enabled in the settings, but when I get a text message (through Hangouts via Google Voice) it never shows the notification on the Watch, just shows the stock text card with stock canned responses like before.
title: Broken

author: ColdPrecision98
comment: Whenever I have 2 convos going on the watch will only send messages to one person not the other please fix asap

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback. The Android Wear application is currently in the process of getting a revamp, with an emphasis being on better tracking of conversations on wear to device interaction for a better experience.

title: Good but

author: Sam Lynskey
comment: Theyve got a great idea/base. Then they proceeded to do things like a 3 response limit ? That's ridiculous. Not to mention other just simple and clearly overlooked problems
title: Desperate

author: Rafael Sereno
comment: It does what it says but with some bugs. Like for example the message showed with the wear its cut off when it's too big.
title: Its still a little green

author: Carlos Serrano
comment: Needs to have whatsapp support... at the very minimum. Also this app has not been updated since June 2015!!
title: So when will it have more support?

author: Peter Brownlow
comment: It's great to have the canned responses but on my phone the notification is never dismissed and the message is never marked as read, which tricks me into thinking that I have an unread message. Huawei Watch & HTC One m8.

author: Jacquie Higgins
comment: Does not work, bought full version, options on watch say to buy full version to use features, canned responses do not send

author: tj clark
comment: My custom responses are not showing up. Using a galaxy note 3 and samsubg gear live. Please help
title: Not working

author: B E Smith
comment: Use it frequently
title: Wear responses

author: MILES MILLER
comment: Didn't work

author: Simon Ravel Schwartz
comment: It is not working at all...

author: Auri Rahimzadeh
comment: Great for responding from the watch. A feature that *should* be built-in. Unfortunately, it sometimes responds to the wrong message. Oftentimes it's the message before the *after* you're responding to that receives the message. Not sure why this happens, but they should fix it :) Would give 5 stars otherwise.
title: Great, but sometimes responds to wrong messages

author: Jordan M. Almonte
comment: It's ok. Mms like group chat is not supported and also there's a bug if you have multiple conversations open and you reply to one it sometimes gets sent to one of the other convos. I think this happens mostly with the canned messages. Still annoying and has been doing this for months. Hope it gets fixed. -HTC m8 and Moto 360 combo

author: Craig Stevenson
comment: Listing said ad free but right from first start up it played ads. Not a fan but not willing to pay the huge fee to upgrade

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content:
Listing says its ad-free if you purchase the unlocker or use one of the IAP to donate:

"With the purchase of the Unlocker, you gain access to the following:

* Ad-free experience"

title: Ad free. Not!

author: Gennady Stolyarov
comment: Crashes too often. Only 3 responces in free version

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Please create an issue report here https://github.com/BMc08GT/WearResponses-issue-tracker/issues/ for the crashes, or send me an e-mail so we can get them rectified for the next release.

title: Good idea but ...

author: Raz Pavel
comment: The developer was quick to address the FC issue. This is a solid wear app. The only thing that is keeping me from give it 5⭐is the fact that after every major update I had to rebuild the custom responses list. It would be nice if the app data would "survive" the update process.

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: I will look into the data survival. I personally haven't seen this. I will open an issue on the tracker. If you could please provide as much feedback for the issue, this will greatly help with the fixing of this issue. Issue is located here: https://github.com/BMc08GT/WearResponses-issue-tracker/issues/13

title: Good Wear App

author: J-P Tru
comment: Watch app crash when I press mark as read. And also, sms doesn't mark itself as read once responded from watch

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Sorry you are having issues. Please if you are able to, create an issue on the issue tracker (create an individual issue for each issue) and this will be resolved. https://github.com/BMc08GT/WearResponses-issue-tracker/issues

title: A lot of potential but

author: Isaac Sommers
comment: This is a great, efficacious app. Pictures for contacts show up fine, the watch vibrates on new notifications, and you can customize your replies to quite a large degree. Purchasing will give you access to features like additional custom responses, and starting a conversation directly from your watch.  I suggest to the developer to add an option to launch the WearResponses app on the watch from the home screen. Perhaps tap and hold the top right corner to launch the WearResponse watch app would be very handy (see what I did there?).

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Version 2.0.0 supports all SMS applications, as well as showing the contact photos on an incoming SMS if the user has a photo saved.

title: Works excellently.

author: Col Kinsey
comment: If you have no responses in sms and you ask it to fetch it crashes everytime. Like this app, looking forward to it getting better.

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Thank you for the feedback. This issue has been resolved for the next release. :)

title: Too expensive

author: Michael Cruz
comment: The app selectively chooses when to turn on the screen or show a card on my 360. Other than that, the functionality seems OK.

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Is this still occuring for you? If so, please if you are able to, create an issue on the issue tracker (create an individual issue for each issue) and this will be resolved. https://github.com/BMc08GT/WearResponses-issue-tracker/issues

title: Not bad

author: Keyur Desai
comment: Unable to verify liscence. Please help. I have emailed the developer twice. Issue not solved yet
title: Unable to verify liscence

author: Reuben Robinson
comment: Is a refund possible ? The responses won't sort alphabetically & the settings to only show favorites keeps resetting back to my entire contact list.

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Sorry you are having issues. Please if you are able to, create an issue on the issue tracker (create an individual issue for each issue) and this will be resolved. https://github.com/BMc08GT/WearResponses-issue-tracker/issues

author: Alejandro Villa Renteria
comment: This app can be even greater if they include support for some other apps, like Telegram or Hangouts.

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Thanks for the kind words. Hangouts support is currently in the works; hopefully more information will be released on this soon.

title: Great

author: Eran Elbaz
comment: On nexus 5 with kitkat 4.4.4
title: Crashes

author: Salwa Kharrufa
comment: Working on moto 360 with note 3 stock messaging app. Thank you
title: Good

author: Paul Unger
comment: Good app, but I preferred the old xposed version.
title: Does what it says.

author: Clay Koehler
comment: Works as advertised

author: Dan Regev
comment: Tried it several times. Stops every time. Also app stops at LG G3. It is rooted properly.
title: Not working on LG G Smartwatch R

author: Christofer Hiitti
comment: Gets FC on lg g watch r. It used to work

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Please check out the latest beta available from the google + community (https://plus.google.com/communities/108173403192126583315)

title: Not working

author: Sander Brand
comment: Nice! Would be better if we can use this app with WhatsApp

author: Tyler Bibeault
comment: While I did get it to worn on my watch I noticed that I was no longer hearing the notification noise. My phone did vibrate though like I said it didn't make the notification noise that was set up. I deactivated the module and restarted and upon receiving a message it worked fine. Other than that one problem I had little issue with it.
title: It works well for what it's intended.

author: Christian Aldridge
comment: Requires the Xposed Framework (which I think needs root) but other than that confusion for me, it's perfect. Developer got back to me immediately and helped walk me through it.
title: Just what I needed

author: George Merlocco
comment: This kind of functionality should have been native to Android Wear.
title: Stellar!

author: Nico Salvador
comment: Hope you can add Textra support in the future as well!

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Textra support is slotted for the next beta release. :)

author: Michael Burns
comment: Awesome piece of work..   Having a issue with it not listing all my contacts, when trying to send a message.. Needs to have a option to select a group of contacts..

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: This is one of the features that I have in the pipeline for a future release. stay tuned.

title: Needs work, but great..

author: NRG Z28
comment: So far so good, but I strongly feel you should get rid of the stupid and frustrating "showcase" in the beginning

reply.author: Brandon McAnsh
reply.content: Thank you for the review. The ability to skip the showcaseView has been added to the first beta release 1.0.1. Please see the G+ community for access (https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/112445658759903851512). Once the bugs that it addressed are confirmed resolved widespread it will be pushed to production.

title: Good
